Hi there,

I have a test method along the lines of:

@Test(expected =3D IOE=
xception.class)
public void testErrorResult() throws Exception
{
    assume=
True(someCondition());
    codeThatShouldThrowIOException();
}

When someCo=
ndition() is true, the test method behaves correctly -- it passes if codeTh=
atShouldThrowIOException() throws the exception and fails if the exception =
is not thrown. 

However, if someCondition() is false, I'd expect the test =
to pass no matter whether we expect exceptions or not. With JUnit 4.6 this =
doesn't seem to hold -- the test with unmet assumption fails, probably beca=
use it expects an exception that the code doesn't even have a chance to thr=
ow. Is this the intended behaviour? If so, is there any way to use @Test(ex=
pect =3D ...) with assumptions?

Thanks,

Staszek
